intro: Stillingia pacifica, commonly known as Pacific stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia pacifica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
